nodes.title: Computer Science
nodes.overview: The study of computation, information processing, and the design of computer systems. It encompasses both theoretical foundations and practical applications of computing.

nodes.title: Web Development
nodes.overview: The practice of building and maintaining websites and web applications. It includes frontend, backend, and full-stack development using various technologies and frameworks.

nodes.title: Frontend Development
nodes.overview: The client-side of web development focused on what users see and interact with. It involves HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frameworks to create responsive and interactive user interfaces.

nodes.title: Backend Development
nodes.overview: The server-side of web development that handles data processing, business logic, and database interactions. Backend developers work with servers, APIs, and databases to power web applications.

nodes.title: React
nodes.overview: A popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces with a component-based architecture. React enables developers to create reusable UI components and efficiently update the DOM.
